refnamediv.refpurpose: The exists command evaluates an expression and return 1 if true, zero if false. It serves roughly the same purpose for objects in a BRL-CAD database that the UNIX test command serves for files on a file system, with additional features specific to geometry and minus some of the filesystem specific options of test.

refsection.para: exists works in a fashion similar to Unix-style test commands (internally it is based on NetBSD's test code) but tests objects in the current open database rather than files in a file system. If an object matching a valid expression or expressions is found 1 is returned, otherwise 0 is returned. Expressions are formed using PRIMARIES and OPERATORS. A simple object name with no primaries or operators will return true if db_lookup succeeds and the object is non-null (TODO).

refsection.para: primaries can be combined with the following operators:

listitem.para: The and operator operates like the logical AND operator - TRUE only if both expressions are true.
The logical OR operator - true if either expression is true.
Evaluates to true if the expression inside the parenthesies evaluates to true. Used to establish order of operations.

refsection.para: The -a operator has higher precedence than the -o operator.

All primaries and operands must be expressed as separate arguments to exists. In practice, this means that there must be a space between each element in a exists expression. E.g. !(-c object1.s -a (object1.s -beq object2.s)) must be written as:
